text:
October 1, 1956
Jfr. Franklin A. Moody
Department of Dramatic Arts and Speech
University Dramatic Center
University of Delaware
Newark, Delaware
Dear Mr. Moodyt
Me were very interested to learn of your move to the University of Delaware and
are happy to send you information about a new membership and the fall convention.
As you probably know. Active and Associate memberships in the NAEB are institutional
member ships. Therefore, the University of Tampa will continue to be a member
through this year, and subsequently of course if they continue to pay dues. If
the University of Delaware is presently producing regularly scheduled radio or
TV programs over commercial stations, the University is eligible for Associate
membership. If programs are not produced on a regular basis. Affiliate membership
may be applied for. Of course, if your plans for a TV station progress to the
point where a CP is issued you would then be immediately eligible for Active
membership•
For your convenience I am enclosing Associate and Affiliate application forms
and a few items to help you explain the NAEB to those with whom you are now
working. If you need anything else “persuasive" just let me know. Of course,
once the University joins the Association we will do everything possible to help
with your plans for the new TV station.
I am sending you a preliminary program and hotel reservation card for the
Atlanta Convention. Me will be looking forward to seeing you there, and if you
have any other questions, please do not hesitate to let me know.
Sincerely,
Harold E* Hill
Associate Director
